values:
Just a little bit bored Take the quiz: "What type of kisser are you?"

Romantic kisser
This kind of kisser will be a good husband or wife.
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/27749.html

considering that Geoff was voted nicest, and that we surprisingly do not have much in common other than friends and eachother.
Kindness


Kindness is most important in a boyfriend/girlfriend. You want someone who will go through everything with you - the best moments and the worst, and all of those other moments in between. You love to be able to say anything to your partner, and have them say anything to you. You are able to be extremely close with your partner for that reason.


Take this quiz at QuizGalaxy.com
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/27580.html

I really can't believe how good everything is going so far this year.  Part of last year was fun, but to be completely honest I was miserable most of the time and I was always counting the days until I got to go home.  I cried a lot and I didn't even know why.  This year everything has been going great, to a point where I am waiting for something to go wrong... just like it did last year.  I can't help but thinking that way...it's just that I have a hard time believing that everything is going to be better this year because of a few great girls that I met. 

I am really hoping that I'll be this happy for the rest of the year, and perfectly content staying away from home.  I no longer count the days until I go home, I actually lose track of time up here and have my mom say "we haven't seen you for over 3 weeks are you going to come home soon?"
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/27231.html

So today has just been one of those days that I wish I never rolled out of bed. I'm just in a bad mood and I'm soooooo tired. I can't wait for the week to end.  I am sick of school work and I want/need a break from it. Definitely looking forward to the four day weekend...but knowing my luck it'll rain through the whole break. :(
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/26944.html

Yes I know that I haven't updated this in a really long time. But that's because I was soooo busy working and hanging out with friends and of coarse hanging out with Geoff over the summer:) And so far this year of school has been soooooooooo much better than last year! Things with Jenna have been awesome, she's the best roommie ever! It's nice to have a roommate that I actaully have things in common with. I have been hanging out with the girls a lot too! Ok that's all for now :)
You are Storm! You are very strong and very protective of those
you love. You are in tune with nature and are
very concerned with justice and humanity.
Unfortunately, certain apprehensions and fears
are very hard for you to overcome, and can
often inhibit you when most need to be strong.

Which X-Men character are you most like?
brought to you by Quizilla
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/26649.html

Today I got to spend sometime with Brenna :) We had a good time together and we are planning on hanging out again sometime soon. We definitely had some interesting and random conversations... it was funny.

I also went to see the play with Beth and went out to eat with her and Sam which was fun because I haven't seen the girls in a while. Hopefully all of us girls will be able to get together and hang out like old times.

Time to go to sleep or else I'll never drag my butt out of bed tomorrow!!!
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/26489.html

It's great to be home...but no one is home yet. Plus I have sooooooo much stuff piled up in my room that I brought home from college. There is no way that it's all staying in my room, I'm going to have to get some storage bin thingys and stick the stuff in the garage or basement. I can't wait until all of the girls get home! And Geoff too! Beth is coming home tomorrow but we probably won't see each other because we will both have a lot of unpacking to do. But on Tuesday we should definitely be able to hang out, we definitely have a lot of catching up to do. And on Saturday I think I'm going to UMASS Lowell to spend the night one last time before Geoff comes home :) I had to put this in because Geoff's obsessed with this show and I thought he'd get a kick out of it. Clearly I am desperate for entertainment...you guys better hurry up and finish your finals!!!
Which Family Guy character are you?
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/26217.html

We are soooooo close to being done it's killing me!  One in class exam tomorrow and two take-home exams that are due on Monday.  I'm hoping to finish the two take-home exams sometime Saturday so that I can get home ASAP because I'll have nothing to do while everyone else is studying & such. 

I wish that I got to know some of the girls that I met up here earlier, we would have had a lot of good times :) And hanging out with them would have made my first year much more enjoyable... But we'll have plenty of time next year!

I just grabbed a really late lunch and this song was playing and now I can't get it out of my head.  I've definitely heard it before, I'm thinking it's from the early 90s... so here it is hopefully I'll get it out of my head and into yours!


"You Gotta Be" 

Listen as your day unfolds 
Challenge what the future holds 
Try and keep your head up to the sky 
Lovers, they may cause you tears 
Go ahead release your fears 

Stand up and be counted 
Don't be ashamed to cry 

You gotta be 
You gotta be bad, you gotta be bold 
You gotta be wiser, you gotta be hard 
You gotta be tough, you gotta be stronger 

You gotta be cool, you gotta be calm 
You gotta stay together 
All I know, all I know, love will save the day 

Herald what your mother said 
Readin' the books your father read 
Try to solve the puzzles in your own sweet time 
Some may have more cash than you 
Others take a different view 
My oh my heh, hey 

You gotta be bad, you gotta be bold 
You gotta be wiser, you gotta be hard 
You gotta be tough, you gotta be stronger 
You gotta be cool, you gotta be calm 
You gotta stay together 
All I know, all I know, love will save the day 

Don't ask no questions, it goes on without you 
Leaving you behind if you can't stand the pace 
The world keeps on spinning 
You can't stop it, if you try to 
This time it's danger staring you in the face 

Oh oh oh Remember 
Listen as your day unfolds 
Challenge what the future holds 
Try and keep your head up to the sky 
Lovers, they may cause you tears 
Go ahead release your fears 
My oh my heh, hey, hey 

You gotta be 
You gotta be bad, you gotta be bold 
You gotta be wiser, you gotta be hard 
You gotta be tough, you gotta be stronger 
You gotta be cool, you gotta be calm 
You gotta stay together 
All I know, all I know, love will save the day 


Nope that didn't work, the song it still stuck in my head and it's probably going to be there for a loooong time, or until I get another song stuck in my head.  Time to study some more and work on my finals.
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/26002.html

Please don't worry about it Geoff.  We aren't going to be like "those couples", because we are sooo different and because I love you tooooo much!  I hope that you know that I really love you more than anything!  And that there is absolutely no doubt in my mind  ...I know that I want to spend the rest of my life with you.  There would be no point in being with you if I had any doubts.  That's how I know that what we have is real, I really don't have any doubts or worries when it comes to us.  Deep down I just know that we are meant to be together.
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/25798.html

Ok...so I didn't get to really sleep in today, and I kept waking up throughout the night, it could be worse.  To look on the bright side, today is my last day of STATS the last time I ever have to take a math course :) !!!  It is also my last day with Silos, which is awesome because I really don't like having my grade based solely on 4 things...you do bad on one and you are done for.  It is also my last day of my 6:00-7:15 class :)  

I'm thinking that I'll be able to pull of finishing both my stats and child psych take-home tests sometime Saturday...so that means I'll be out of here by Saturday...Sunday the absolute latest!!! Yaaaay for summer vacation which = relaxing, going to the beach (I really need a tan, I'm almost as white as Geoff!), seeing my friends, spending more time with my family and of coarse GEOFF!!!  I can hardly wait :)
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/25529.html

By this time next week I'll be on summer vacation.  Lately I've been having fun with some of the girls up here, but I'll get to see them all next year...I am just ready for a break from school work.  To be completely honest, I can't wait to go home and relax! 

I didn't get much sleep last night, hopefully I'll have better luck tonight :)
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/25303.html

Wow I only have 6 more days of classes/finals!!!

I thought that last night was going to suck because Geoff couldn't come up and because I didn't really have any plans.  But I was talking to Krystle at dinner and she told me that I could hang out with her and her friend later on that night.

I definitely had a fun time last night with Krystle... and surprisingly we got up in time to grab some breakfast with Brittany.  Now I'm getting ready to go out to eat with Geoff :)  Hopefully he'll get here soon because I'm getting antsy...
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/24860.html

I need to stop being so nice to everyone...I'm sick of having other people walk all over me and then feeling bad about calling them on it.

Yeah, that whole "nap thing" did not work out...the kids have been set free outside and the're running around and screaming.

"Anywhere With You"

I know i can't come near you 
Every time i do 
I get shaken inside and the sun in my eyes 
I'll stay away 
I'd rather be here 
than anywhere with you 
Whoo 
I'd be dancing with your ghost 
Toasting note to note 
So here's to the passing 
of all that could be 
between you and me 
I'd rather be here 
than anywhere with you 
Whoo
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/24795.html

I've come to the conclusion after talking with others that some people are...

a.)  Rude
b.)  Selfish
c.)  Oblivious
d.)  Or maybe it's all of the above

I hope this day ends a lot better than it started at 7 am... taking a nap is looking good, but as usual I'm sure something will come up between my classes, or I'll be woken up by screaming children...fabulous
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/24413.html

I was just talking to Geoff a little while ago about coming up this weekend.  Originally we had plans for him to come up here and go out to eat Friday night...But he went to the doctor and found out that he's sick.  The doctor gave him some medicine, but he's still not feeling so hot.  Earlier today he said that he would still come up, but then he called a little bit later and said that he was probably going to wait until Saturday morning to come up so that he could get some rest.  Of coarse I was bummed out because I've been wicked excited about our plans for Friday.  And obviously Geoff could tell that I was disappointed so he was saying that he would just come up Friday.  So as usual I've made Geoff feel bad, and now I feel guilty.

Id like him to come up, but now I'm hoping that he'll just stay home Friday night so he'll feel better...I guess I'll just have to find something to do all by my lonesome :(
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/24278.html

Yaaay there are no screaming kids outside my window for once.  This weekend I went home to bring home a bunch of my stuff so I can get out of here ASAP.  The highlight of my weekend was going to the Ipswich Bar & Grill with Geoff.  The food was soooo goooooood as always.  Other than that I basically spent my time unpacking a lot of the stuff I brought home.  Right now I have work that I could be doing, but I figure I'll hold it off because I CAN :)

I stole this from Jason...I was reading and laughing the whole time.  Some of this stuff I definitely remember, others I don't because I was a little bit too young.

YOU KNOW YOU GREW UP IN THE LATE 80s EARLY 90s iF ....
1. You've ever ended a sentence with the word "SIKE"
2. You watched the Pound Puppies. and I even had a couple of them
3. You can sing the rap to the "Fresh Prince of Belair" ...and can do the "Carlton". Who doesn't know the words?
4. Girls wore biker shorts under their skirts and felt stylishly sexy. --> My cousin is guilty of this, I don't think I ever did
5. You yearned to be a member of the Baby-sitters club and tried to start a club of your own.
6. You owned those lil' Strawberry Shortcake pals scented dolls.
7. You know that "WOAH " comes from Joey on Blossom
8. Two words: Hammer Pants--> I definitely remember the hammer pants, but no I did not own a pair
9. If you ever watched "Fraggle Rock"--> my favorite!!! "Throw your cares away...worries for another day..."
10. You had plastic streamers on your handle bars... and "spokey-dokes" or playing cards on your spokes for that incredible sound effect
11. You can sing the entire theme song to "DuckTales " (Woo ooh!)-->loved the show
12. It was actually worth getting up early on a Saturday to watch cartoons. We had the best ones!!
13. You wore a ponytail on the side of your head.--> Bren wore one up until 6th grade because her mom said she was too old!
14. You saw the original "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles " on the big screen...and still know the turtles names.
15. You got super-excited when it was Oregon Trail day in computer class at school.
16. You made your mom buy one of those clips that would hold your shirt in a knot on the side.
17. You played the game "MASH " (Mansion, Apartment, Shelter,House)--> also "CASH" c= castle
18. You wore stonewashed Jordache jean jackets and were proud of it.
19. L.A. Gear....need I say more?
20. You wanted to change your name to "JEM " in Kindergarten.(She's truly outrageous.)
21. You remember reading "Tales of a fourth grade nothing" and all the Ramona books.
22. You know the profound meaning of "WAX ON, WAX OFF"
23. You wanted to be a Goonie.
24. You ever wore fluorescent clothing. (some of us...head-to-toe)
25. You can remember what Michael Jackson looked like before his nose fell off and his cheeks shifted.
26. You have ever pondered why Smurfette was the only female smurf.
27. You took lunch boxes to school... and traded Garbage Pail kids in the schoolyard.
28. You remember the CRAZE, then the BANNING of slap bracelets.
29. You still get the urge to say "NOT " after every sentence.
30. You remember Hypercolor t-shirts.
31. Barbie and the Rockers was your favorite band.
32. You thought She-ra (Princess of Power!) and He-Man should hook up.
33. You thought your childhood friends would never leave
because you exchanged handmade friendship bracelets.
34. You ever owned a pair of Jelly-Shoes. --> I loved Jelly shoes!
35. After you saw Pee-Wee's Big Adventure you kept saying "I know you are, but what am I?"
36. You remember "I've fallen and I can't get up"
37. You remember going to the skating rink before there were inline skates.
38. You ever got seriously ! injured on a Slip and Slide.
39. You have ever played with a Skip-It.--> I was the queen of skip-it and hula hooping
40. You had or attended a birthday party at McDonalds.
41. You've gone through this nodding your head in agreement.
42. You remember Popples.
43. "Don't worry, be happy"
44. You wore like, EIGHT pairs of socks over tights with high top Reeboks.
45. You wore socks scrunched down (and sometimes still do... getting yelled at by "younger hip" members of the family)
46. You remember boom boxes. . and walking around with one on your shoulder like you were all that.
47. You remember watching both "Gremlins " movies.
48. You know what it meant to say "Care Bear Stare!!"
49. You remember watching "Rainbow Bright" and "My Little Pony Tales"
50. You thought Doogie Howser/Samantha Micelli was hot.
51. You remember Alf, the lil furry brown alien from Melmac.
52. You remember New Kids on the Block when they were cool... and don't even flinch when people refer to them as "NKOTB".
53. You knew all the characters names and their life stories on "Saved By The Bell," The ORIGINAL class.
54. You know all the words to Bon Jovi - SHOT THROUGH THE HEART.
55. You just sang those words to yourself.
56. You remember watching Magic vs. Bird.
57. Homemade Levi shorts.. (the shorter the better)
58. You remember when mullets were cool!
59. You had a mullet!
60. You still sing "We are the World"
61. You tight rolled your jeans.
62. You owned a bannana clip.
63. You remember "Where's the Beef?"
64. You used to (and probably still do) say "What you talkin' about Willis?"
65. You had big hair and you knew how to use it.--> OMG, my mom gave me feathered bangs in first grade! It was HORRIBLE
66. You're still singing shot through the heart in your head, aren't you!!!
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/23842.html

It's Brenna's Birthday, Happy Birthday Brenna!!!

That also means that my birthday is in exactly 6 months.  Just think, in 6 months I'll be 20...how weird is that???
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/23653.html

Today definitely dragged on, but I thought that it was going to be much more stressful than it was.  I did a lot of school work, but managed to hang out with Jenna for a couple of hours.  It's so weird how I can already tell that we are going to click a lot better than I have with anyone else up here.


The Latest weird conversation with my Mom....

kjmom723: holy crap@!!
kjmom723: I was looking for a snack and all I could fine was wheat thins and easy cheese.
kjmom723: have you ever been "shot" by easy cheese?
kyla102185: nope...only you
kjmom723: I'm serious, it scared the crap out of me.


I'm definitely dreading tomorrow... 45 minute presentation in front of my class, 5 page paper to write and an online test to do :(
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/23445.html

Tonight was room draw.  Jenna and I actually managed to get into the building that we wanted, and we got two windows!  We are in Lawson, which is a suite style dorm building; we'll be sharing a suite with 3 other girls and 3 guys.  Hopefully we'll all get along ok, because we'll be sharing a kitchen and living room.  I wish that we could find out who we are sharing the suite with ahead of time.  Oh well, I'm sure everything will work out.  If things are bad, we'll only have to deal with it for 2 weeks!

Time for more homework :(
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/23074.html

We were talking about how young she'll probably be when she has granchildren.

kyla102185: i can't wait until you turn 50
kyla102185: you'll be a grandma before you are 50
kyla102185: so then people will think you are even older
kjmom723: 50 would be okay.
kjmom723: 45-50 is okay.
kjmom723: I want to be young enough to be active with them.  Not in a wheelchair drooling.
kjmom723: maybe god will punish me for saying that and I'll get into a car accident tomorrow and end up in a wheel chair, drooling for the rest of my natural life.
kyla102185: haha
kyla102185: highly inlikely
kjmom723: and your responsibility after dad leaves me.
kyla102185: right
kjmom723: not really.  Tammy is driving.
kyla102185: hahaha
kyla102185: buckle up!
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/22913.html

This weekend was the best one that I've had in a while.  Geoff and I went back to Rockport to hang out and relax.  I actually managed not to stress out about all of the work that I still have to do.  We went to millbrook park and played some frisbee with Tim and Hilary.  That night we watched "The Monster Squad" with Jeffrey and ordered some pizza.  And today we played some more frisbee, and some weird baseball game with Tim, and Eli...that I'm really not sure how to explain.  And after that we met up with Katie, Dave and Brian and went to look at Dave and Katie's new apartment.  I couldn't believe how big their apartment was!  To bad Geoff and I can't move in together yet :(  

Well tonight he's spending the night up here :) And I have to get going to bed because I have an early work study tomorrow.
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/22628.html

I wish it was Friday! I can't wait to get away from here! 

I went to dinner alone (what else is new? I practically do it at every meal) and got some food, took maybe two bites of each thing on my plate and got up and threw it out.  So much for enjoying dinner.

I think I'm going to finish my homework while it's quiet in my room.  Then I'll go to the gym for a couple of hours, because that's the only thing that takes my mind off of everything else.
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/22277.html
One month from today will be my last day of school :)
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/22066.html

Yaaaaaaaay, I definitely have a roommate for next year!  Now I can stop worrying about getting stuck with someone that I don't get along with...again. :)



I started the longest survey ever... and I quit on question 71... I'm not really sure how you got through that one Jen.
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/21896.html

Ok...so I ran into Jenna at dinner and we were talking about the whole roommate situation.  She said that she decided to tell her friend that she didn't think that it would be a good idea to room with her.  So now we are planning on rooming together if their little chat goes good.
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/21756.html

Geoff and my mom always tell me to be more optimistic.  Lately I've been trying to be and well it didn't go so well.  I got excited about the possibility of rooming with Jenna.  Unfortunately a friend of hers kind of got ditched by the girl she had planned to room with.  So now Jenna is going to room with her.  So now I am basically stuck in the same boat that I was in before.  If I went into this expecting nothing, I wouldn't I have felt as disappointed. 

But Jenna and I are planning on hanging out anyway.  So I guess I gained a friend.
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/21311.html

So yeah, Geoff called before I was heading off to class to give me some "good news" earlier.  I had absolutely no idea what the "good news" was...this is Geoff we are talking about.

He had talked to his parents and they told him that after we get married, and they retire (well his Dad already retired...) we can have their house.  Well they aren't going to just hand over the house to us, we will buy it, except it won't be EXTREMELY expensive...like every house in Rockport.  Geoff had mentioned the possibility of this happening before, but I didn't know whether or not his parents were serious about it...until now.

It's funny that we are talking about this now since...
1.) We are both under 20
2.) We're both in college
3.) Not engaged/married...yet :)

But then again we have been together for over 3 years.  We plan on being engaged (by senior year) and married (probably after Grad school.) Well despite all of this it just seems crazy that we have a "potential" house to buy.
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/21156.html
It's funny how much some people "change" after you think that you really know them.
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/20748.html

So I went to the little get together to meet some people who were looking for a roomate.  I went in thinking that either 
a.) no one else would show up
or 
b.) they would all be really weird and crazy

  About 5 other girls showed up and everyone seemed to be really nice.  There was one girl that I really got along with, she was awesome.  We seemed to have a lot and common and we kept making eachother crack up.  After we met and talked to everyone, we all wrote down the names of any of the girls that could be potential roomates.  The two of us put down eachother.  I'm just hoping that I'm her top pick out of the other girls because we seemed to have A LOT in common.  Hopefully we'll get eachother's information soon and hang out and maybe even room together :)
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/20677.html

I went to the gym earlier and I am feeling really good.  But I'm probably really going to feel sore tomorrow!!! I am definitely going to get back into the habit of going to the gym everday that I'm up here.  And then I'll try to get some sort of exercise over the weekends.  Geoff is starting to go to the gym everyday too...so we are kind of motivating eachother to go.  We decided not to "let ourselves go" yet. hehehe
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/20466.html

I know it's my fault we drifted and if I could do anything to change it I would.  That is one of my only regrets.  We keep talking about getting together sometime but we are to much alike for our own good.  I think you are always busy, and you think I am always busy.

"I'd like to be the sort of friend that you have been to me;
I'd like to be the help that you've been always glad to be;
I'd like to mean as much to you each minute of the day
As you have meant, old friend of mine, to me along the way."
 

After reading that quote you KNOW that I am talking about you.  If you really want to come up here to see me, or hangout over some weekend call me.  I find it very hard to believe that you spend your days sitting around waiting for "you know who."  Even though its been a while... I'm still here for you if you need me.
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/20135.html

"Without You"

But I'm looking forward to the sun

I thought by now the time 
Would take away these lonely tears

'Cause baby I can't live 
 
Without you I'm not okay 
And without you I've lost my way 
My heart's stuck in second place ooh 
Without you Without you
http://kyla1021.livejournal.com/19358.html

It's late and I'm bored, but I can't sleep.  I'm going to fill out this thingy that I stole from Jen's livejournal.  I guess if you are bored you can waste your time reading it.  I was a bit disappointed with Stephen Lynch.  He was funny, but not my favorite comedian that I've seen at CSC.  Ok here it goes....

 

// The Basics
---> Name: Kyla Kristy
---> Birth date: 10-21-85
---> Birthplace: born in Gloucester raised in Rockport
---> Current Location: New London, NH / Rockport, MA
---> Eye Color: hazel/brown
---> Hair Color: dirty blonde?
---> Righty or Lefty: righty
---> Zodiac Sign: Libra
---> Innie or Outtie: Innie

// Series Two - Describe
---> Your heritage: Irish, French Canadian, Scottish & English (all the ones that get bad sunburns!)
---> The shoes you wore today: My brown "height shoes"
---> Your hair: Down and naturally wavy
---> Your eyes: ...uuum still hazel/brown
---> Your weakness: I'm passive & painfully shy
---> Your fears: Being alone, death-losing a family member
---> Your perfect pizza: Extra Cheese- where I get it depends on my mood
---> One thing you'd like to achieve: Graduate/Get my masters

// Series Three - What is
---> Your most overused phrase on aol\aim: I don't think I have a "phrase" I use
---> Your thoughts first waking up: "Today should be fun"
---> The first feature you notice in the opposite gender: Face-eyes & Smile
---> Your best physical features: My tummy :)
---> Your usual bedtime: Around 12
---> Your greatest accomplishment: Coming to Colby-Sawyer and not giving up even when I wanted to
---> Your best memory: With Geoff :)

// Series Four - Do you
---> Smoke: never have, never will
---> Cuss: A little...never the "F" word
---> Sing well: I'm ok I guess...I only sing along with the radio blasting so no one can hear me
---> Take a shower everyday: Yup
---> Want to go to college: I'm in college...
---> Like high school: Yes
---> Want to get married: Absolutely
---> Type with your fingers on the right keys: Yup, but I peek at the keys when I type fast
---> Believe in yourself: not really
---> Get motion sickness: Never
---> Think you're attractive: No, not really...but I could look worse
---> Think you're a health freak: no definitely not
---> Get along with your parents: yes
---> Like thunderstorms: Yes, lightening is the best
---> Play an instrument: nope, I wanted to play the flute when I was younger

// Series Five - In the past month, did/have you
---> Drank alcohol: yes
---> Smoke(d): nope
---> Made Out: yes
---> Gone on a date: Yeah, I guess we went on a real date for our 3 year anniversary
---> Gone to the mall: yes
---> Been on stage: no
---> Been dumped: nope
---> Gone skating: yup, and I was pretty bad...rollerblading is a lot easier

This weekend was good, with the exception of finding out that my Dad has diabetes, and seeing my mom get really upset about it.  Seeing her cry is a rare thing.  I'm not worried because my dad is young and he basically just made the cut of being considered "diabetic."  Friday night I stayed up at Lowell with Geoff, and Saturday morning we went home.  The weekend definitely went by too fast.

I'm looking forward to seeing Steven Lynch on Tuesday.  Katie and Dave are coming up, so it should definitely be a good time.  Unfortunately Geoff can't come because he has a play he has to go see for a class.

I'm definitely going through another "phase" where I'm really unhappy up here.  This would be so much easier if I was with Geoff, or one of my friends from back home.  I hope this passes soon.  If it doesn't stop by next year I'm going to go crazy.  I've talked with my mom, Geoff and his mom about going to another college; but I really don't think that it would change anything.  Well Jason's going to give me a little tour of McKean, maybe I'll have better luck there.

Yesterday was definitely a stressful day for me.  I had a lot of work that I had to do, and I also had a lot on my mind.  I tried to brush the stress aside and keep doing my work, and then my mom called.  I told her what was going on, and she was worried that I was holding things off (which I'm not) and that my GPA would drop and I'd get booted out of the school because there is no way I could afford to go here without my scholarships.

Another thing that is really starting to bother me again is being alone.  I'm so sick of feeling alone when I'm surrounded my hundreds of people.  I'm sick of eating alone, sitting in my room, crying, and trying to convince myself that everything will change.  Geoff has mentioned that I should look at other colleges, but I'm not fully convinced that it would change much.  I really like the teachers, classes and major that I have.  There aren't many schools that offer child development as a major.  I don't really know what to do, or even say anymore.  I've pretty much convinced myself that things here will never get better, they'll only get worse, no matter where I go.

Time to go eat brunch alone.

I can't believe how fast the time that I spend with you flies by.  It seems like it was only yesterday when you told me that you "really liked me" and that you wanted me to be your girlfriend.  I remember talking for hours while you pushed me on the swing in the park, and while we sat on the beach that night.  I'll never forget when you asked if you could kiss me (I won't ever let you live that one down, it was so cute.)  I'll always remember you walking me to all of my classes with a brief kiss before each departure, and the summer nights when you insisted on walking me home. 
 
Thanks to you the past three years have been the best of my life.  I couldn't dream of having a better boyfriend, you're the best!  You are always so sweet and understanding and you never fail to make me smile.  I love the fact that we still hold hands, say "I love you," and talk about our future. I hope that our relationship continues to grow with each passing year.
